t: Psalm 18

For the director of music. Of David the servant of the Lord. He sang to the Lord the words of this song when the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul. He said:
I*pn love you, Lord,*s my strength.
The*pn Lord*s is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my*ld God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my*ld shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold.
I*pn called to the Lord,*s who is worthy of praise, and*ld I have been saved from my enemies.
The*ln cords of death entangled me; the*ld torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.
The*ln cords of the grave coiled around me; the*ld snares of death confronted me.
In*pn my distress I called to the Lord;*s I*ld cried to my God for help. From*ln his temple he heard my voice; my*ld cry came before him, into his ears.
The*ln earth trembled and quaked, and*ld the foundations of the mountains shook; they*ld trembled because he was angry.
Smoke*ln rose from his nostrils; consuming*ld fire came from his mouth, burning*ld coals blazed out of it.
He*ln parted the heavens and came down; dark*ld clouds were under his feet.
He*ln mounted the cherubim and flew; he*ld soared on the wings of the wind.
He*ln made darkness his covering, his canopy around him— the*ld dark rain clouds of the sky.
Out*ln of the brightness of his presence clouds advanced, with*ld hailstones and bolts of lightning.
The*ln Lord*s thundered from heaven; the*ld voice of the Most High resounded.
He*ln shot his arrows and scattered the enemy, with*ld great bolts of lightning he routed them.
The*ln valleys of the sea were exposed and*ld the foundations of the earth laid bare at*ln your rebuke, Lord,*s at*ld the blast of breath from your nostrils.
He*pn reached down from on high and took hold of me; he*ld drew me out of deep waters.
He*ln rescued me from my powerful enemy, from*ld my foes, who were too strong for me.
They*ln confronted me in the day of my disaster, but*ld the Lord*s was my support.
He*ln brought me out into a spacious place; he*ld rescued me because he delighted in me.
The*pn Lord*s has dealt with me according to my righteousness; according*ld to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.
For*ln I have kept the ways of the Lord;*s I*ld am not guilty of turning from my God.
All*ln his laws are before me; I*ld have not turned away from his decrees.
I*ln have been blameless before him and*ld have kept myself from sin.
The*ln Lord*s has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according*ld to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
To*pn the faithful you show yourself faithful, to*ld the blameless you show yourself blameless,
to*ln the pure you show yourself pure, but*ld to the devious you show yourself shrewd.
You*ln save the humble but*ld bring low those whose eyes are haughty.
You,*ln Lord,*s keep my lamp burning; my*ld God turns my darkness into light.
With*ln your help I can advance against a troop; with*ld my God I can scale a wall.
As*pn for God, his way is perfect: The*ld Lord’s*s word is flawless; he*ld shields all who take refuge in him.
For*ln who is God besides the Lord?*s And*ld who is the Rock except our God?
It*ln is God who arms me with strength and*ld keeps my way secure.
He*ln makes my feet like the feet of a deer; he*ld causes me to stand on the heights.
He*ln trains my hands for battle; my*ld arms can bend a bow of bronze.
You*ln make your saving help my shield, and*ld your right hand sustains me; your*ld help has made me great.
You*ln provide a broad path for my feet, so*ld that my ankles do not give way.
I*pn pursued my enemies and overtook them; I*ld did not turn back till they were destroyed.
I*ln crushed them so that they could not rise; they*ld fell beneath my feet.
You*ln armed me with strength for battle; you*ld humbled my adversaries before me.
You*ln made my enemies turn their backs in flight, and*ld I destroyed my foes.
They*ln cried for help, but there was no one to save them— to*ld the Lord,*s but he did not answer.
I*ln beat them as fine as windblown dust; I*ld trampled them like mud in the streets.
You*ln have delivered me from the attacks of the people; you*ld have made me the head of nations. People*ln I did not know now serve me,
foreigners*ld cower before me; as*ld soon as they hear of me, they obey me.
They*ln all lose heart; they*ld come trembling from their strongholds.
The*pn Lord*s lives! Praise be to my Rock! Exalted*ld be God my Savior!
He*ln is the God who avenges me, who*ld subdues nations under me,
who*ld saves me from my enemies. You*ln exalted me above my foes; from*ld a violent man you rescued me.
Therefore*ln I will praise you, Lord,*s among the nations; I*ld will sing the praises of your name.
He*pn gives his king great victories; he*ld shows unfailing love to his anointed, to*ld David and to his descendants forever.
